p: Nevertheless, viral genetic information is often found to be incorporated to cellular genomes (Holmes 2011). For example, human chromosomes contain more viral DNA than actual human genes. In fact, remnants of viruses are abundant in genomes of many different organisms, ranging from animals to bacteria (Casjens 2003; Katzourakis and Gifford 2010; Jalasvuori et al. 2010). How did these viral elements get into all these organisms? What types of evolutionary processes may be responsible for these genomic fusions, and could they be of evolutionary importance?
